title: Oka coherence theorem
summary: In mathematics, the Oka coherence theorem, proved by Kiyoshi OkaÂ (1950), states that the sheaf O := O C n {\displaystyle {\mathcal {O}}:={\mathcal {O}}_{\mathbb {C} _{n}}} of germs of  holomorphic functions on C n {\displaystyle \mathbb {C} ^{n}} over a complex manifold is coherent.[1][2]
